title: Showers expected in several areas today
byline: Showers will occur at times in the Western, Sabaragamuwa and Central provinces and in the Galle and Matara districts today (24), the Department of Meteorology stated.

title: At least 20 injured elephants receiving treatment at present
byline: At least 20 injured elephants are currently receiving treatment across the country, according to the Department of Wildlife Conservation.

title: Apple beats US appeal claiming it shortchanged customers on iCloud storage
byline: A U.S. federal appeals court on Wednesday rejected claims by Apple customers that the iPhone maker gave them less iCloud data storage than they paid for when upgrading.

title: Two arrested with ‘Ice’ worth Rs. 600,000 in Maligawatte
byline: A male and a female have been arrested while transporting a stock of “ice” drugs worth over Rs. 600,000 in a three-wheeler, police stated.

title: Final rites of Most Ven. Anamaduwe Sri Dhammadassi Thero to be held in Kandy
byline: The final rites of the late Anunayake of the Asgiri Chapter of the Siam Sect, Most Venerable Anamaduwe Sri Dhammadassi Thero is scheduled to take place with state sponsorship today (24).

title: India, U.K. to sign free trade agreement today
byline: Britain and India will sign a landmark free trade agreement on Thursday during a visit by Indian Prime Minister Narendra Modi, sealing a deal to cut tariffs on goods from textiles to whisky and cars and allow more market access for businesses.

title: Two Thai civilians killed as Thai and Cambodian militaries clash at disputed border
byline: At least two Thai civilians have been killed and two others injured by shelling from the Cambodian side on July 24.

title: SC defers sentencing in contempt of court case filed against Immigration Controller General
byline: The Supreme Court has deferred the sentencing to September 23 in the contempt of court case filed against Harsha Illukpitiya, the Controller General of Immigration and Emigration, who has pleaded guilty.

title: Doctor pleads guilty to selling Friends star Matthew Perry ketamine
byline: A doctor who was a primary target in the sweeping investigation of actor Matthew Perry’s overdose death pleaded guilty Wednesday (Jul 23) to supplying the Friends star with ketamine despite knowing he was a struggling addict.

title: Australia to lift import ban on US beef after Trump tariffs tiff
byline: Australia will lift restrictions on the import of beef from the US, a trade barrier which had angered the Trump administration.

title: Bollywood star Hrithik Roshan to replace Shah Rukh Khan for City of Dreams opening
byline: Indian film superstar Hrithik Roshan is scheduled to visit Sri Lanka next month to attend the grand inauguration of the City of Dreams Sri Lanka project, which will officially open on August 2.

title: Parliament to debate proposed education reforms
byline: An adjournment debate on the proposed education reforms is scheduled to be held in Parliament today (24).

title: Alibaba launches open-source AI coding model, touted as its most advanced to date
byline: Alibaba Group announced on Wednesday the launch of Qwen3-Coder, an open-source artificial intelligence model for software development that the Chinese e-commerce giant described as its most advanced coding tool to date.

title: Chief Justice underscores need for changes to laws amidst rising public concerns
byline: Chief Justice Murdu Fernando has underscored the need for legal renewal amidst rising public concerns about the legal system in an evolving society.

title: Rohini Kaviratne’s comments spark heated exchange in Parliament
byline: A heated situation arose in Parliament due to Cretan comments made by Samagi Jana Balawegaya (SJB) MP Rohini Kaviratne, targeting the Speaker of the House, Dr. Jagath Wickramaratne, while she was asking a supplementary question this morning (23).

title: Ex-Batticaloa OIC held under PTA for concealing info linked to Easter attacks
byline: The Special Unit of the CID has informed the Colombo Fort Magistrate’s Court that a former OIC of the Batticaloa Police is being detained and interrogated under the PTA in connection with an investigation related to the Easter Sunday attacks.

title: Air India crash: Wrong bodies sent to grieving families in UK
byline: Multiple British families of Air India 171 crash have received wrong bodies, according to a report.

title: Special Presidential Investigation Committee appointed to probe irregularities at SriLankan Airlines & AASL
byline: President Anura Kumara Dissanayake has appointed a Special Presidential Investigation Committee to probe alleged incidents of fraud, corruption and irregularities at SriLankan Airlines Limited and Airport and Aviation Services (Sri Lanka) (Private) Limited, the President’s Media Division (PMD) said.

title: CID assistance sought to probe deaths of four elephants
byline: A request has been made to the CID and the Scene of Crime Officers of the Police Department to promptly provide support for necessary investigations related to the deaths of four elephants in Sigiriya and Galgamuwa, according to the Department of Wildlife Conservation.

title: Fallon Shilanthi becomes first Sri Lankan Canadian to win Mrs. Canada World
byline: Fallon Shilanthi, a proud Sri Lankan Canadian, has made history by being crowned Mrs. Canada World 2025–2026, becoming the first woman of Sri Lankan descent to earn this prestigious title.

title: Ozzy Osbourne, Black Sabbath frontman and godfather of heavy metal, dies at 76
byline: Ozzy Osbourne, the gloomy, demon-invoking lead singer of the pioneering band Black Sabbath who became the throaty, growling voice — and drug-and-alcohol ravaged id — of heavy metal, died Tuesday, just weeks after his farewell show. He was 76.

title: Ranil’s emergency regulations in 2022 violated fundamental rights – SC rules
byline: The Supreme Court, in a majority decision, today ruled Fundamental Rights have been violated through then Acting President Ranil Wickremesinghe’s orders to disperse the ‘Aragalaya’ protestors from Galle Face on 17 July 2022, by resorting to Emergency Regulations under the Public Security Act.

title: Doha-bound Air India flight faces technical snag; plane makes precautionary landing
byline: A Doha-bound Air India Express flight from Calicut International Airport was forced to return on Wednesday morning due to a technical fault, airport officials confirmed.

title: Youth commits suicide after murdering girlfriend, injuring her parents
byline: A young woman residing in the Marangala area of Padiyathalawa, Ampara, has been found murdered after having her throat slit by her boyfriend who had later committed suicide by slitting his own throat.

title: Man dies in house fire in Narahenpita
byline: An individual has died in a fire that broke out at a residence in the ‘397 Waththa’ area of the Narahenpita Police Division early this morning (23).

title: Speaker certifies National Minimum Wage for Workers Amendment Bill
byline: Speaker Dr. Jagath Wickramaratne today (23) endorsed his certification on the three Bills, the Budgetary Relief Allowance of Workers (Amendment) Bill, the Budgetary Relief Allowance of Workers (Amendment) Bill, and the National Minimum Wage for Workers (Amendment) Bill.

title: Sri Lanka to shift from exam-centric education to module-based system by 2026: PM
byline: Prime Minister and Minister of Education, Higher Education, and Vocational Education, Dr. Harini Amarasuriya, announced today (23) that Sri Lanka is shifting away from an education system solely focused on pass or fail examination outcomes.

title: Silver prices surge to highest in 14 years
byline: Silver prices surged to their highest in almost 14 years on Wednesday, aided by worries about U.S. tariff policy, signs of tightness in the spot market and growing investor interest in alternatives to gold.

title: HC to consider Rajitha Senaratne’s bail revision application on July 30
byline: The Colombo High Court has ordered that the petition filed by former Minister Rajitha Senaratne, seeking a revision of the Colombo Magistrate’s Court order refusing him bail, be taken up for consideration on July 30.

title: Preethi Padman Surasena confirmed as next Chief Justice of Sri Lanka
byline: The Constitutional Council has ratified President Anura Kumara Dissanayake’s nomination of Supreme Court Justice Preethi Padman Surasena as the next Chief Justice of Sri Lanka.

title: Man arrested in Rajagiriya with ‘Kush’ worth Rs. 12 Mn
byline: An individual has been arrested with a stock of Kush cannabis valued at approximately Rs. 12 million in Rajagiriya.

title: Sri Lanka and Pakistan keen to strengthen defence sector partnerships
byline: Sri Lanka and Pakistan have reiterated the importance of reinforcing defence sector partnerships across multiple domains.

title: Sri Lanka to join China-ASEAN Expo in September as special partner
byline: Sri Lanka will join as a Special Partner Country for the 22nd China-ASEAN Expo (CAEXPO) scheduled for Sept. 17-21 in Nanning, capital city of south China’s Guangxi Zhuang Autonomous Region, the expo secretariat confirmed on Wednesday.

title: Asian Development Bank lowers Sri Lanka’s GDP growth estimate for FY2025
byline: The Asian Development Bank (ADB) has revised downward its GDP growth forecast for Sri Lanka, primarily due to the effects of US tariff policies.

title: Meta introduces new safety tools to protect teens and children on Instagram
byline: Meta has unveiled a series of new safety measures aimed at enhancing protections for teens and children on Instagram. These updates are part of the company’s ongoing commitment to preventing both direct and indirect harm to young users on its platforms.

title: Indonesia to cut tariffs, non-tariff barriers in US trade deal
byline: Indonesia has agreed to eliminate tariffs on more than 99% of U.S. goods and scrap all non-tariff barriers facing American firms, while the U.S. will drop threatened tariffs on Indonesian products to 19% from 32%, the two countries said on Tuesday.

title: Trump says US will impose 19% tariff on imports from Philippines in deal struck with leader Marcos
byline: President Donald Trump said he has reached a trade agreement with Philippine leader Ferdinand Marcos Jr., following a meeting Tuesday at the White House, that will see the U.S. slightly drop its tariff rate for the Philippines without paying import taxes for what it sells there.

title: Sri Lanka’s Central Bank keeps policy rate unchanged
byline: The Monetary Policy Board has decided to maintain the Overnight Policy Rate (OPR) at the current level of 7.75% at its meeting held on Tuesday (July 22), the Central Bank of Sri Lanka (CBSL) announced today.

title: Japan’s Prime Minister Ishiba to quit after election drubbing, local media report
byline: Japanese Prime Minister Shigeru Ishiba will announce his resignation by the end of next month, Japanese media reported on Wednesday, following a bruising election defeat that cost his administration its upper house majority.

title: No decision taken to curtail vehicle imports – CBSL Governor
byline: Neither the Central Bank of Sri Lanka (CBSL) nor the government has taken any decision to impose restrictions on vehicle imports at present, the Governor of the Central Bank of Sri Lanka (CBSL) Dr. Nandalal Weerasinghe has clarified while responding to recent media reports.

title: Draft of National Media Policy unveiled
byline: The draft of the National Media Policy has been unveiled by the Ministry of Mass Media.

title: ‘Red’ warning issued for strong winds and rough seas
byline: A ‘Red’ warning has been issued by the Department of Meteorology for strong winds and rough seas in the areas extending from Kalpitiya to Kankasanthurai via Mannar.

title: 16 students injured in school bus accident in Beligalla
byline: A bus transporting school children veered off the road in the Beligalla area along the Beliatta–Weeraketiya road at around 7:30 a.m. this morning (July 23).

title: White House unveils artificial intelligence policy plan
byline: The White House released an artificial intelligence (AI) policy plan on Wednesday spelling out priorities for the U.S. to achieve ‘global dominance’ in the sector.

title: President Dissanayake pays last respects to Asgiri Anunayake Thero
byline: President Anura Kumara Dissanayake paid his final respects to the late Anunayake of the Asgiri Chapter of the Siam Sect, Most Venerable Anamaduwe Sri Dhammadassi Thero at the Udugama Sri Buddharakkitha Memorial Hall of the Asgiri Temple in Kandy last night (22).

title: Sri Lanka, Thailand discuss expanding bilateral cooperation and FTA Implementation
byline: The Ambassador of the Kingdom of Thailand to Sri Lanka, Mr. Paitoon Mahapannaporn, paid a courtesy call on the Speaker of the Parliament Dr. Jagath Wickramaratne, on Tuesday (22) at the Parliamentary premises.

title: UAE ranked safest country in the world in 2025; Sri Lanka drops to 61st
byline: The UAE has once again been named the safest country in the world, according to the Safety Index by Country 2025 Mid-Year, published by global data aggregator Numbeo.

title: Sri Lankan passport makes big jump in global rankings, Visa-Free entry to 42 countries now
byline: The Sri Lankan passport has made a major leap and climbed five places from 96th to 91st, in the Henley Passport Index.

title: SJB member elected Chairman of Weligama PS after open ballot
byline: Samagi Jana Balawegaya (SJB) member Lasantha Wickramasekara has been elected as new the Chairman of the Weligama Pradeshiya Sabha.

title: President arrives in Parliament
byline: President Anura Kumara Dissanayake arrived in Parliament, a short while ago, Ada Derana reporter said.

title: X-Press Pearl Disaster: SC orders shipping company to pay US$1 bln in compensation
byline: The Supreme Court of Sri Lanka today (24) ordered a shipping company to pay US$1 billion in compensation for the environmental and economic damage caused due to the fire onboard the X-Press Pearl vessel, Ada Derana reporter said.

title: No survivors in Russian passenger plane crash near China border, local reports say
byline: A Russian passenger aircraft crashed in the Amur region near the China border on Thursday.

title: Man armed with gun fails in attempt to shoot health administrative officer in Dehiwala
byline: A health administrative officer escaped unharmed after an assailant’s gun failed to fire adjacent to the S. de S. Jayasinghe grounds in Dehiwala this morning, police stated.

title: Cardi B sued for battery over 2023 Las Vegas mic-throwing incident
byline: Rapper Cardi B is facing a lawsuit for assault and battery stemming from a 2023 incident at Drai’s Beachclub in Las Vegas, where she allegedly threw a microphone at an audience member.

title: Son-in-law of MP Rohitha surrenders to court
byline: The son-in-law of Member of Parliament Rohitha Abeygunawardena has surrendered to the Matugama Magistrate’s Court a short while ago.

title: Over Rs. 3 bln earned from issuance of import & export control licenses in 2024
byline: The Department of Import and Export Control has reported a revenue of Rs. 3.7 billion for the year 2024, generated through the issuance of import and export control licenses.

title: UN body says Israeli forces have killed over 1,000 aid-seekers in Gaza since May, as hunger worsens
byline: More than 1,000 Palestinians have been killed by Israeli forces since May while trying to get food in the Gaza Strip, mostly near aid sites run by an American contractor, the U.N. human rights office said Tuesday.

title: Thailand, Cambodia border row spirals into deadly clash, killing 11
byline: At least 11 civilians were killed Thursday when Thailand and Cambodia exchanged airstrikes, rockets and artillery fire, in a dramatic escalation of a long-running border row.

title: Japan agrees to continue granting scholarships to Sri Lankan public sector workers
byline: The government of Japan has signed an agreement to continue its scholarship programme for executive-level government officials in Sri Lanka.

title: India resumes visas for Chinese tourists amid thawing ties
byline: India has resumed issuing tourist visas to Chinese nationals after a five-year gap as the two countries continue to explore ways to mend their strained relationship.

title: No legal provisions for companies to charge 2.5%–3% fees on card transactions: CBSL
byline: Companies and institutions have no legal provisions to impose additional charges ranging from 2.5% to 3% on customers for transactions made using credit or debit cards, the Director of Payments and Settlements at the Central Bank of Sri Lanka (CBSL), Vasantha Alwis has stated.

title: Chinese cybercrime suspect detained at BIA and deported
byline: A 28-year-old Chinese national suspected of involvement in an international cybercrime ring was arrested by the Border Surveillance Unit of the Department of Immigration and Emigration upon his arrival at Bandaranaike International Airport (BIA), Katunayake.

title: Five new foreign envoys present credentials to the President
byline: Five newly appointed ambassadors and one high commissioner to Sri Lanka officially presented their credentials to President Anura Kumara Dissanayake at the Presidential Secretariat this morning (24).

title: Bodies of mother and 2 daughters found in well in Mankulam
byline: The bodies of a mother and her two daughters have been recovered from a well located in the garden of a residence in the Panikkankulam area of Mankulam in Mullaitivu today (24), according to Mankulam Police.

title: Rohitha’s son-in-law remanded; Jagath Vithana’s son granted bail
byline: Dhanushka Weerakkody, the son-in-law of Member of Parliament Rohitha Abeygunawardena, has been remanded until August 01 after surrendering to the Matugama Magistrate’s Court today.

title: Parliament to debate removal of Deshabandu Tennakoon on Aug 5
byline: The debate on the resolution for the removal of suspended Inspector General of Police (IGP) Deshabandu Tennakoon from office, under Section 17 of the Removal of Officers (Procedure) Act, No. 5 of 2002, is scheduled to be held in Parliament on August 05.

title: Police Sub-Inspector arrested for soliciting bribe
byline: A Sub-Inspector attached to the Kompannavidiya Police Station was arrested by officers of the Commission to Investigate Allegations of Bribery or Corruption (CIABOC) near the Fort Magistrate’s Court premises for allegedly soliciting a bribe of Rs. 100,000.

title: Govt takes responsibility for providing optimal school education for every child - President
byline: President Anura Kumara Dissanayake stated that the proposed education reform is not merely limited to curriculum revision but will simultaneously elevate both the social and economic spheres of the country.

title: President directs implementation of urgent measures to address human-elephant conflict
byline: President Anura Kumara Dissanayake held a discussion this afternoon (24) at the Presidential Secretariat with relevant Ministers and Officials regarding the protection of wild elephants and the safeguarding daily lives of rural community.
